description: Since his rise to prominence on the Israeli political stage in the early 1990s, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has repeatedly insisted that the regime in Tehran poses an 'existential threat' to Israel.

description: At least 265 bodies have been found at the site of the crash of a London-bound Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner passenger airplane in Ahmedabad, India. One passenger survived.

headline: 'You've started a fire': TikTok execs fail to convince French lawmakers at hearing
description: On Thursday, several TikTok executives tried to reassure a parliamentary committee investigating the platform by outlining the measures implemented to protect minors.

headline: Paris Games balloon returns to French capital, minus the Olympic name
description: The balloon has been installed in the Tuileries Garden. It will rise into the sky with its electric flame on June 21.

headline: In Rome, Maria Grazia Chiuri's final bow
description: It was in her hometown that Dior's artistic director, Maria Grazia Chiuri, chose to stage her farewell show on May 27. Though nothing was revealed that day about her departure, the designer decided to celebrate the art and culture of the Italian capital, where she has just brought a small theater back to life near the Forum.

description: Le Monde, Forbidden Stories and media partners investigated arbitrary arrests of Malians committed by Russian mercenaries. We reveal at least six bases where civilians were illegally detained and secretly tortured.

headline: The life and death of Julie, 21, swept up in the spiral of social media
description: Julie Pospieszny's tragic fate was that of a young woman of her generation, born into the age of social media and a victim of the violence it can unleash. Caught in the spiral of easy money and addicted to laughing gas, the influencer died in March. She was 21 years old.

headline: The Dulcie September case exposes France's troubling ties with South Africa during apartheid
description: Thirty-seven years after the unsolved assassination of the African National Congress (ANC) representative in Paris, a French court on Tuesday dismissed her family's complaint against the state for 'denial of justice' and 'gross negligence.'
